action.action-desc: Ms. Velázquez (for herself, Mr. Serrano, Mr. Meeks, and Mr. Jeffries) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To authorize programs and activities to support transportation options in areas that are undergoing extensive repair or reconstruction of transportation infrastructure, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Increase Transportation Alternatives Investment Act of 2017.
Section 133 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Transportation alternatives for areas undergoing extensive repair or reconstruction of transportation infrastructure
subsection.text: The Secretary shall issue regulations to ensure that States give preference to eligible projects under this section thatâ€”

paragraph.text: are located in areas that are undergoing extensive repair or reconstruction of transportation infrastructure, including Federal-aid highways, federally owned roads open for public travel, passenger rail facilities, and public transportation facilities; and
will provide transportation alternatives related to the full or partial closure of the transportation infrastructure in such areas.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Transportation shall carry out a grant program to support community efforts to invest in transportation alternatives.
Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall award grants under the program on a competitive basis.

In awarding the grants, the Secretary shall give preference to projects located in areas that are undergoing extensive repair or reconstruction of transportation infrastructure, including Federal-aid highways, federally owned roads open for public travel, passenger rail facilities, and public transportation facilities.
The following entities shall be eligible to receive grants under the program:
Amounts received in grants under the program may be used to plan for, facilitate, and provide initial support for any of the following activities:

paragraph.text: Transportation demand management programs, including support for transportation management associations.

Planning, design, acquisition of rights-of-way, construction, improvement, and management of streets, pathways, and public transportation facilities to facilitate expanded bicycle and pedestrian mobility and access.

subsection.text: To receive a grant under the program, an eligible entity shall submit to the Secretary an application in such form and manner as the Secretary prescribes.
